## Iren SaltalÄ±

**MSc. Computer Engineer**
*Ankara, Turkey*

**Phone:** (90) 536 387 7379
**Email:** iren@saltali.com
**LinkedIn:** [iren.saltali](https://www.linkedin.com/in/iren.saltali) | **Twitter:** [iren.saltali](https://twitter.com/iren.saltali)

---

### Summary

Hands on data infrastructure leader with 10+ years of experience designing, scaling, and operating petabyte-scale pipelines that power real-time product decisions and ML workloads. Architect and strong cloud-native, self-healing platformsâ€”most recently Apache Flink, Apache Kafka, ClickHouse, and S3 at EdgeDelta, and a Kubernetes-based microservices data pipelines on ClickHouse at Wopeâ€”that ingest more than 25 billion rows per day, achieve five nines availability, and keep infrastructure spend in check through smart partitioning and auto-tuning. By partnering closely with data science, product, and content teams, I turn raw events into trusted, discoverable datasets and metrics that drive cross functional roadmaps. I cultivate a "Freedom and Responsibility" cultureâ€”raising the talent bar, mentoring senior Ics, and prioritizing context over controlâ€”while upholding rigorous data quality and observability through test driven development, contract tests, and anomaly detection so downstream experimentation and personalization just work.

---

### Core Competencies

- **Languages:** Python, Go, Java, C#, JS, Data
- **Data & Streaming:** Flink, Spark, Kafka, ClickHouse, Kinesis
- **Cloud & Infra:** AWS, Kubernetes, Docker
- **Architecture:** Microservices, distributed systems, HA design
- **Engineering:** TDD, CI/CD, observability, cost optimization
- **Leadership:** Cross-functional teams, mentoring, agile

---

### Experience

#### **Staff Software Engineer (Data & Platform Team)** | **EdgeDelta, Seattle, USA**
*AGU 2024 - PRESENT*

As a Staff Software Engineer on the Data & Platform team, I maintained and delivered large-scale for real-time observability and anomaly detection. I architected a streaming pipeline using Apache Flink (Java/Scala) and Apache Kafka, with downstream storage in ClickHouse on S3, that ingests and analyzes over petabytes of log/metric/trace data per day with sub-minute latency and 99.999% availability. I implemented algorithms in Go, Java, and Python for error outlier detection and deployment fault analysis, enabling proactive insights for customers. I collaborated closely with data science and product teams to turn raw telemetry into discoverable, trusted datasets that powered ML and anomaly features. In addition, I led cross-functional projects from ambiguous requirements to production, contributed to open source, and deepened expertise in distributed systems, stream processing, and cost-efficient scaling.

#### **Wope, Salope, USA â€” CTO**
*OCT 2021 - JUN 2024*

At Wope, I combined hands-on engineering with technical leadership to build the world's most extensive rank-tracking platform. I architected a Clickhouse-based microservices pipeline (35+ services) that processed over 25 billion rows of data monthly with high availability and low latency. Using Go and Python, I implemented scalable services for ingestion, transformation, and analytics, enabling real-time query responses on massive datasets. I executed a zero-downtime migration of billions of rows between database vendors, ensuring continuity and data integrity. Beyond coding, I led a 20+ person engineering team, driving best practices in distributed systems, mentoring senior engineers, and aligning technical direction with product strategy.

#### **Software and Cloud Architecture Consultant** | **Neurocess Limited, London, UK**
*MAY 2021 - JAN 2022*
*English, Turkish*

I am designing and leading the development of cloud architectures and cloud software.

#### **.NET Software Consultant** | **Kloia, Istanbul, Turkiye**
*NOV 2020 - OCT 2021*

In was in charge of all the processes in modernizing .NET for our companies. I designed and led the development of extensible enterprise-grade software and cloud architecture. I established and promoted best practices and patterns in software architecture.

#### **Information Technology Trainer** | **BilgeAdam Academy, Istanbul, Turkiye**
*JAN 2019 - PRESENT*

I am an outsourced trainer for OOP with a C++ course for Bilge Adam. In addition, I gave training to companies like Siemens.

#### **Technical Co-Founder** | **Image4io, Istanbul, Turkiye**
*OCT 2018 - OCT 2021*

My responsibility was to manage and complete all marketing, operational and technical aspects of the company. In addition, I created a globally available SaaS product with a complex architecture that includes edge computing, storage management, image optimization, high availability and CDN. I also designed the cloud & software architecture of the product for enhanced performance and cost optimization. Furthermore, I built a user console and REST API with .NET Core MVC, an image optimization and manipulation program with C++, and edge computing functions with Node.js and Python.

#### **Software Engineer** | **Lumigo, Tel Aviv, Israel**
*DEC 2020 - SEP 2021*

I was a freelance software engineer. I built Lumigo's .NET tracer and delivered it to them.

#### **Founder** | **Notedu, Istanbul, Turkiye**
*AUG 2015 - JAN 2019*

I created a platform for university students where they can sell or buy lecture notes online. I made all search engine optimization from scratch. The platform reaches 30K/monthly users without any ads. I built an entire web application and REST API and designed a mobile app with technical and UI details. I used AWS and DigitalOcean as cloud providers.

#### **Software Engineer & System Administrator** | **Turkish Navy Research Center Command, Istanbul, Turkiye**
*AUG 2015 - MAR 2018*

In my role, I was responsible for administering isolated server groups. I manage physical and virtual servers. I use and manage different kinds of operating systems like Ubuntu, CentOS, Solaris and Windows. I was in charge of the virtual and physical security of servers. I have learned and created warfare software with Ada.

---

### Non-Related Experience

#### **Executive Officer** | **Turkish Navy (AB-27 Patrol Boat), Istanbul, Turkiye**
*APR 2012 - AUG 2013*

#### **Fire Control Officer** | **Turkish Navy (TCG Gaziantep Frigate), Mugla, Turkiye**
*SEP 2010 - APR 2012*

#### **Production Officer** | **United Nations (CTF 151), Gulf of Aden**
*OCT 2011 - DEC 2011*

---

### Education

#### **MSc. Computer Engineering** | **Istanbul Technical University, Istanbul, Turkiye**
*2013 - 2015*

#### **MSc. Computer Engineering (Erasmus Program)** | **AGH University of Science and Technology, Krakow, Poland**
*2014 - 2015*

#### **BSc. Computer Engineering** | **Turkish Naval Academy, Istanbul, Turkiye**
*2005 - 2009*

---

### Publications

[Scene analysis through auditory event monitoring DAAâ€™16 Proceedings of the International Workshop on Social Learning and Multimodal Interaction for Designing Artificial Agents](https://scholar.google.co.uk/citations?user=iYnwvly4AAA)
*NOV 16, 2016*

[Sound source identification for scene analysis Signal Processing and Communications Applications Conference (SIU) 2015 23th.](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3005338.3005343)
*MAY 16, 2015*

[https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/7129931](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/7129931)

---

### Certifications

#### **AWS Certified Solutions Architect**
*Earners of this certification can design cost and performance-optimized solutions and demonstrate a strong understanding of the AWS Well-Architected Framework.*

#### **AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner**
*Earners of this certification have a fundamental understanding of IT services and their uses in the AWS Cloud.*

---

### Recognitions

**I've been an AWS Community Builder** since 2020. Directory [link](https://aws.amazon.com/developer/community/builders/).

---

### Volunteering

#### **Co-Organiser, Cloud and Serverless Turkey** | **FEB 2018 - PRESENT**

This community is for anyone interested in developing web, mobile, and IoT apps using the Serverless Framework! The topics discussed are AWS Lambda, API Gateway, Microsoft Azure Functions, Apache OpenWhisk, Google Cloud Functions, IoT, FaaS, IaaS, microservices, serverless application development, developer tools, DevOps, event-driven architecture, etc.

#### **AWS UG Leader, AWS User Group Ankara** | **JULY 2023 - PRESENT**

Recognized by AWS as the official leader of the Ankara AWS User Group, organizing meetups, workshops, and community events that bring together cloud professionals and enthusiasts. Foster knowledge sharing on AWS technologies, connect local members with the global AWS community, and represent Ankara within the worldwide AWS User Group network.

#### **Coding Educator** | **Ã‡aÄŸdaÅŸ YaÅŸamÄ± Destekleme DerneÄŸi**
*SEP 2017 - JAN 2018*

I gave coding training to secondary school children in this education foundation.

description.html:
DESCRIPTION

This position is part of the AWS Specialist and Partner Organization (ASP). Specialists own the end-to-end go-to-market strategy for their respective technology domains, providing the business and technical expertise to help our customers succeed. Partner teams own the strategy, recruiting, development, and growth of our key technology and consulting partners. Together they provide our customers with the expertise and scale needed to build innovative solutions for their most complex challenges.

Do you have an extensive background in delivering strategic outcomes for security and compliance and a passion for working with customers to solve complex technical challenges to help them safely transition workloads to the cloud?

Increasingly, companies are using AWS to move their core business applications to the cloud. AWS is looking for passionate and experienced security professionals to work with these customers to help guide their vision, address risks and implement their security, resilience, and compliance strategies on the AWS platform. This role will provide thought leadership and operate with a high degree of autonomy and visibility as part of our worldwide specialist team. This role will be located in the United States and have global responsibilities working with sales, product marketing and product management. The role will focus on providing Technical Thought Leadership for the Communication Developer Services organization and will be service aligned to AWS Wickr.

This role will advise and deliver strategic outcomes across a wide range of industry sectors and challenging environments. They will challenge, dive in to the details, and show how AWS can support complex security, availability, and compliance strategies, to customer Security Architects and CISOs.

This key position requires broad industry experience and will have high visibility at the most senior levels of customer organizations, including frequent interaction with customer board, their staff, and AWS senior leadership. The position, as part of the AWS worldwide specialist organization, will act as the security interface with AWS customers and service teams working closely with AWS Sales and Solutions Architect teams. The candidate will already have and continue to foster key relationships, be able to interpret the impacts of industry and regulatory changes, and track and report on industry trends.

Key job responsibilities
  • Lead the conversation on security, risk, and compliance with large AWS customers
  • Manage disparate senior stakeholders within customer environments to deliver consensus and drive positive customer outcomes on the AWS
  • Help customers understand how they can integrate AWS security controls into their own control frameworks and demonstrate approaches to implement their controls on AWS.
  • Partner directly with AWS customers to help them understand the implementation of AWS security requirements and how they can achieve ongoing assurance over their security, resilience, and compliance needs
  • Direct AWS Solutions Architects, Sales, and Partner teams across multiple engagements within each customer to drive targeted outcomes and consistent advice and outcomes
  • Work with customers to resolve complex security concerns and problems and achieve security, resilience, and compliance outcomes are on the AWS platform through deep dive discussions, strategic presentations/recommendations, and hands on demonstrations in the AWS environment
  • Develop industry leading security related, customer-facing resources based on projected customer needs and current demand
  • Build great relationships and confidence to help customers understand how to react and respond to security incidents
  • Assist the AWS compliance team in determining the strategic direction of the various AWS compliance programs based on customer interaction and demonstrative metrics.
  • Be and remain connected with industry trends throughout the world as it relates to industry regulations and requirements.
  • Develop and maintain personal relationships with key industry personnel and policy makers.

Looking for candidates with:
  • Experience in directly supporting public sector customers
  • Experience in a customer-facing, sales-aligned role such as consultant, solutions engineer or solutions architect.
  • Experience in directly supporting public sector customers
  • A background working in a regulated industry such as financial services, healthcare, or defense
  • Experience working with IT and Security leadership to articulate identity and security strategies and plans
- Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services- -Security Clearance: Preferred for Candidates to have an active U.S. Government TS/SCI security clearance or the ability to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance

About the team
Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.

Mentorship & Career Growth

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 5+ years of professional or military experience
  • 3+ years of design, implementation, or consulting experience in applications or infrastructures
  • 8+ years within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics)
  • 7+ years of experience in the design, implementation and operation of complex systems
  • 5+ years of experience in an information security or compliance role

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience working internationally and being able to confidently traverse different corporate cultures
  • Deep understanding of cloud computing
  • Demonstration of innovative security, resilience and compliance approaches to solve complex security, resilience and compliance challenges
  • Experience and proficiency in public speaking and can hold own in senior-level presentations and discussions
  • Experience defining security, resilience and compliance strategies, and ensuring that committed outcomes are delivered on schedule
  • A degree in computer science, MIS, engineering or related discipline, and relevant industry certifications (CISSP, CISA/M, CIPP/CIPM/CIPT)

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

Los Angeles County applicants: Job duties for this position include: work safely and cooperatively with other employees, supervisors, and staff; adhere to standards of excellence despite stressful conditions; communicate effectively and respectfully with employees, supervisors, and staff to ensure exceptional customer service; and follow all federal, state, and local laws and Company policies. Criminal history may have a direct, adverse, and negative relationship with some of the material job duties of this position. These include the duties and responsibilities listed above, as well as the abilities to adhere to company policies, exercise sound judgment, effectively manage stress and work safely and respectfully with others, exhibit trustworthiness and professionalism, and safeguard business operations and the Company’s reputation. Pursuant to the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $138,200/year in our lowest geographic market up to $239,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

This role will provide thought leadership and operate with a high degree of autonomy and visibility as part of our worldwide specialist team. This role will be located in the United States and have global responsibilities working with sales, product marketing and product management. The role will focus on providing Technical Thought Leadership for the Communication Developer Services organization and will be service aligned to AWS Wickr.

This role will advise and deliver strategic outcomes across a wide range of industry sectors and challenging environments. They will challenge, dive in to the details, and show how AWS can support complex security, availability, and compliance strategies, to customer Security Architects and CISOs.

This key position requires broad industry experience and will have high visibility at the most senior levels of customer organizations, including frequent interaction with customer board, their staff, and AWS senior leadership. The position, as part of the AWS worldwide specialist organization, will act as the security interface with AWS customers and service teams working closely with AWS Sales and Solutions Architect teams. The candidate will already have and continue to foster key relationships, be able to interpret the impacts of industry and regulatory changes, and track and report on industry trends.

Key job responsibilities
- Lead the conversation on security, risk, and compliance with large AWS customers
- Manage disparate senior stakeholders within customer environments to deliver consensus and drive positive customer outcomes on the AWS
- Help customers understand how they can integrate AWS security controls into their own control frameworks and demonstrate approaches to implement their controls on AWS.
- Partner directly with AWS customers to help them understand the implementation of AWS security requirements and how they can achieve ongoing assurance over their security, resilience, and compliance needs
- Direct AWS Solutions Architects, Sales, and Partner teams across multiple engagements within each customer to drive targeted outcomes and consistent advice and outcomes
- Work with customers to resolve complex security concerns and problems and achieve security, resilience, and compliance outcomes are on the AWS platform through deep dive discussions, strategic presentations/recommendations, and hands on demonstrations in the AWS environment
- Develop industry leading security related, customer-facing resources based on projected customer needs and current demand
- Build great relationships and confidence to help customers understand how to react and respond to security incidents
- Assist the AWS compliance team in determining the strategic direction of the various AWS compliance programs based on customer interaction and demonstrative metrics.
- Be and remain connected with industry trends throughout the world as it relates to industry regulations and requirements.
- Develop and maintain personal relationships with key industry personnel and policy makers.

Looking for candidates with:
- Experience in directly supporting public sector customers
- Experience in a customer-facing, sales-aligned role such as consultant, solutions engineer or solutions architect.
- Experience in directly supporting public sector customers
- A background working in a regulated industry such as financial services, healthcare, or defense
- Experience working with IT and Security leadership to articulate identity and security strategies and plans
- Hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services- -Security Clearance: Preferred for Candidates to have an active U.S. Government TS/SCI security clearance or the ability to obtain a TS/SCI security clearance

About the team
Diverse Experiences

AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasnâ€™t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, donâ€™t let it stop you from applying.

Why AWS?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the worldâ€™s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating â€” thatâ€™s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.

Inclusive Team Culture

AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Weâ€™re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earthâ€™s Best Employer. Thatâ€™s why youâ€™ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, thereâ€™s nothing we canâ€™t achieve.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

- 5+ years of professional or military experience
- 3+ years of design, implementation, or consulting experience in applications or infrastructures
- 8+ years within specific technology domain areas (e.g. software development, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics)
- 7+ years of experience in the design, implementation and operation of complex systems
- 5+ years of experience in an information security or compliance role

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

- Experience working internationally and being able to confidently traverse different corporate cultures
- Deep understanding of cloud computing
- Demonstration of innovative security, resilience and compliance approaches to solve complex security, resilience and compliance challenges
- Experience and proficiency in public speaking and can hold own in senior-level presentations and discussions
- Experience defining security, resilience and compliance strategies, and ensuring that committed outcomes are delivered on schedule
- A degree in computer science, MIS, engineering or related discipline, and relevant industry certifications (CISSP, CISA/M, CIPP/CIPM/CIPT)

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of protected veteran status, disability, or other legally protected status.

position.title: Founder & Former General Manager
position.description:
The launchpad of my entrepreneurial journey and my first professional passion:

- Founded MENA's largest independent marketing consultancy firm at age 21 and bootstrapped from scratch to over 35 team members (now 80+ with our amazing leadership team's guidance)

- Worked with global brands including Amazon, Pepsi, Red Bull, Yandex, MediaMarkt, BNP Paribas, PwC, E&Y, Yves Rocher, Weber, Edenred, Generali, and hundreds moreâ€”helping them win in hyper-competitive search landscapes.

- Had the privilege to represent the company by speaking on global stages like BrightonSEO (4x speaker), SMX, Content Marketing Masters, InOrbit â€” and proudly hosted Digitalzone for 9 straight years, growing it to Eastern Europe's largest digital marketing event.

- Our brilliant teams won UK & MENA Search Awards, with nearly 50 international nominations and numerous wins. Personally served as a judge for prestigious awards ceremonies (European & US Search Awards).

Zeo wasn't just a businessâ€”it shaped who I am, ignited my passion for growth, taught me leadership, and defined my path forward. It's now independently led by an amazing leadership team, but I'll always proudly remain part of its storyâ€”not only as still being partner but because it represents the proudest years of my youth.

posts.text:
The most underrated skill for prompt engineering: Excel mastery. Controlling data in synthetic data preparation is crucial for fine-tuning models. 

No easy Python alternative to intuitive data manipulation of Excel (not Pandas, but spreadsheet-like visual solution).

Concatenating strings, parsing, and API requests can be complex in Python. Excel, with its advanced AppScript functions, is my go-to.Â Anyone else feel the Python data observation tools just don't compare to Excel's simplicity?

I need a Python tool that works like a spreadsheet.Â Neptyne is too developer-oriented and a bit complex. 

Rows's frontend is impressive (kudos to their amazing frontend team - I think it is written on top of Flutter) but their OpenAI integration lacks Azure OpenAI and doesn't work effectively with standard OpenAI's fine-tuned models.

Could it be I've missed a solution? The prompt engineering community would greatly benefit from a tool tailored to our needs, one that eases the process of creating and managing synthetic data. 

If you have suggestions, Iâ€™m all ears!Â ðŸ‘€

posts.text:
Fine-tuning on Microsoft Azure OpenAI is pricier than on standard OpenAI, lacking hosting/training inclusions. Cost per token is low, but the entry cost is excessively high. A rough estimate puts model hosting at $5K/month. 

Given costs, many might stick to OpenAI unless usage necessitates.

comments.text:
Optimizing parameters like epoch count prolongs training, escalating the rate to over $100/hr. Surprising! 

A cheaper, start-up friendly, non-enterprise alternative, similar to OpenAI's model, would make Microsoft Azure more competitive for growing companies.

Economies of scale make sense, but while a cheaper alternative like OpenAI exists, charging startups using Azure credits $5K for a model fine-tuned with 10 examples is steep. 

A hosting cost dependent on token usage would be more reasonable. The 'cost per training hour' mindset is flawed, as clients can't control this cost.

posts.text: Fine-tuning a model and experiencing the mind-blowing outcomes has been the most exciting business experience I have ever had. GPT-4 + CoT + Extra Chains + Standardization & Adjustments = Mind-boggling results. Even "fine-tuned GPT-3.5 Turbo" can outperform "GPT-4 with few-shot" in most cases.

The best thing you can do to improve the output from your prompts is to add an example and let the AI work by looking at this example. 

I don't know if people are intimidated by the jargon because we gave it a cool name like "few-shot", but very few people are using this. 

I might as well say that I never write a prompt without an example. 

- In fact, I write the examples first, then prepare the prompts. 
- Sometimes, if I'm feeling particularly lazy, I might even ask GPT4 to write the prompts by looking at the examples. 

Even when you use such simple things, you can greatly advance your relationship with AI. It's really not hard. Don't hesitate to get your hands dirty.

I've created a Sheets extension to use OpenAI & Pinecone by simple formula. It streamlines vector searches for AI Engineers and data analysts, helping for many cases, including mine: data preparation for model fine-tuning.

1ï¸âƒ£ Type =VECTORDB("your search term") into any cell.
2ï¸âƒ£ Watch the script generate a vector using OpenAI Embeddings.
3ï¸âƒ£ See it search for this vector within Pinecone's database.
4ï¸âƒ£ Query by any metadata.

This is an open-source project that I've published on my Github. Feel free to copy it from Google Sheets for your own use.

If you have any development suggestions, please share them here. 
I'm eager to contribute to moving AI from Python to spreadsheets for next-level AI analysts. So, your ideas are incredibly valuable âœŒï¸

Does more than one prompting method come to mind when you're trying to solve a problem? Or perhaps, no method comes to mind at all.

replies.text: BarÄ±ÅŸ GÃ¼ler Yes, it saves a lot of time ðŸ¤“. At the same time, when you create a solid few shot CoT prompt with GPT4, remove the thought part and train only the model based on the results, very qualified results come. moreover, at a much more reasonable cost.

posts.text:
The future of LLMs is all about high context models. Leading the charge is Anthropic's Claude with a massive 100K context size, surpassing GPT3 (16k), GPT4 (8k), and even GPT4 (32k).

Anthropic published a guide about creating effective prompts for these models.Â  Here are some tipsðŸ§µ

Claude's 100K context window smoothly manages big tech docs. As Claude API expands, we'll need better prompting tips.

This is great for future language models that understand context, real-time help systems, smart prompts, and getting various info without relying on RAG ðŸ¦™

They conducted an experiment to improve Claude's recall of specific info from a long document. A publicly available government document was used as the data source to avoid pre-existing knowledge. You should read this section in the article.

Getting Claude to generate questions is potent, but requires careful prompting to hit the difficulty sweet spot. Challenges: Avoiding questions answerable without document reference, and preventing unintentional clues in answers.

Used a prompt template with sample chunks and hand-written questions as writing examples. Claude pulled relevant quotes using a 'scratchpad' for improved accuracy, with a slight latency cost. (+more costs for API of course)

But, it is less complex than managing RAG and more efficient! The best performance was achieved using numerous examples and the scratchpad. More examples were better, and generic ones didn't help.

Claude 2â€™s accuracy improved from 0.939 to 0.961 with prompting - a 36% error reduction. Long context is an invaluable & blessing for few-shot!Â ðŸ¤©

In conclusion, Claude's 100K token context window is a game-changer for long-context Q&A prompts.  With careful prompting, its potential can be fully exploited.

They shared the whole process on a single notebook, you can reproduce and tinker with it yourself ðŸ¤“

Using AI actively in your daily life introduces a new way of thinking.

Enriching  your perspective through learning with AI is a game-changer.

AI creates a heaven for curious people.

posts.text:
Writing prompts for LLMs are a unique experience. 

When I started doing it full time, taking prompt writing seriously changed my life. 

Now, my main goal is guiding the AI to reach the point I describe. 

It's challenging, but understanding the fundamentals brings great pleasure.

Learning "Chain of Thoughts" and "Few-Shot Prompting" through the examples within academic papers may help you internalize the real concept and truly grasp its inner workings.

Delight in writing prompts that guide AI to think like you by references and create desired outputs.

Seeking AI-based email unsubscription service.

As an early adopter, I test 15-20 products daily. Avoiding fake emails when signing up. 

Joined many, but my inbox is now a trash bin.

I want to eliminate all of them at once.

Tried multiple solutions: AppScript, Gmail filters, LeaveMeAlone, and other SaaS apps.

None fully solve the problem. Internet controllers' greediness is bothersome.

Wish there was a service to unsubscribe us from all newsletters using a headless browser, without vendor lock-in.

comments.text: Hi Yigit. Try to use junk@yourdomain.com email and filter it with gmail. Or be more specific like junk+tag@yourdomain.com so you ll tag&filter it automatically. When you no longer want anything from any tag, simply create a filter and rule which ll block or make read and move away from inbox. As i know you could create unlimited tag like mail+tag@gmailORyourdomain.com

Every weekend, I review 50+ companies and meet with founders throughout the week.  It has significantly impacted my life!

In the near future, voice interfaces are likely to replace typing, revolutionizing the way we design user experiences. This shift is evident in recent updates like Sonoma, the new MacOS, which greatly enhances computer dictation through Transformer-based technology.

Speaking commands instead of typing saves me time & energy. It has the potential to be transformative for workspaces and could revolutionize the coworking industry.

This would require significant changes in interior to accommodate the new way humans interact with computers.

This could potentially lead to a rise in private booths for voice calls, similar to what we have observed at places like WeWork. By utilizing our voices instead of relying solely on keyboards, there is the potential for increased efficiency in both work and thinking processes.

comments.text: Imagine typing and speaking at the same time, a whole new level of multi-tasking user experience design & development!
In the *not that much* near future, brain-computer interfaces are likely to replace *any* input mechanism:)
